definition: to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
see 琢磨[zuo2 mo5]
to cut (gems)
grindstone/to grind/to turn round
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
lit. cutting and polishing (idiom)/fig. to learn by exchanging ideas or experiences

sentences.english: But you guys know T-Mac. He likes to keep people guessing .
sentences.chinese: 你們知道他的，他喜歡讓人們琢磨不透。

sentences.english: I reflected on what Michael said.
sentences.chinese: 我琢磨着邁克爾的這席話。

sentences.english: Perhaps she knew that he was thinking of her thus.
sentences.chinese: 她呢，也許知道他那會兒正琢磨她吧。
他琢磨這樣一個現實的問題。

sentences.english: I was just beginning to wonder where you were.
sentences.chinese: 我剛纔正琢磨你上哪兒去了。

sentences.english: Love always the case, let Ren pondering impenetrable.
sentences.chinese: 愛情總昰這樣，讓秂琢磨丆透。

sentences.english: The visitor can ponder over the boomerangs used by aborigines at the time of Cook.
sentences.chinese: 來訪者可以琢磨琢磨土著人在庫克時期用的回飛鏢。

sentences.english: The visitor can ponder over the boomerangs used by aborigines at the time of Cook.
sentences.chinese: 來訪者可以琢磨琢磨土著人在庫克時期用的回飛鏢。

sentences.english: Wolpoff of the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor wonders whether the Flores find might even represent an offshoot of Australopithecus.
sentences.chinese: 則琢磨弗洛瑞斯島人骨甚至可能代表南猿人的一支。

sentences.english: For almost a year he pondered what the sound of one hand might be.
sentences.chinese: 他用了近一年的時間琢磨隻手空音到底是啥。

sentences.english: We can look things up, but we can’t figure anything new out.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以查東西，卻不能琢磨出任何新東西。

sentences.english: Man, the Scots have this marriage thing figured out.
sentences.chinese: 人，蘇格蘭人把結婚這件事琢磨透了。

sentences.english: Other people also have multi-faceted, say so people are elusive.
sentences.chinese: 另外人還具有多面性，所以說人是琢磨不透的。

sentences.english: Watching her, I pondered doing something uplifting with the rest of the day.
sentences.chinese: 我端詳着她，開始琢磨在今天剩下的時間裏做些什麼。

sentences.english: The moodiness of adolescents makes it all the more tricky, Grady says.
sentences.chinese: 青少年的喜怒無常使這種情況更加令人琢磨不透。

sentences.english: She's been puzzling over his strange letter for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 她幾個星期也琢磨不透他那封奇怪的來信。

definition: to consider/to ponder
to analyze/to try to figure out/to try to fathom
to plot/to scheme/to calculate
to think deeply/to ponder
(dialect) to savor/to test the taste of/(fig.) to ponder upon/to mull over
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to talk about often/to reminisce about/to keep repeating/to keep harping on/to discuss
to reckon/to guess
to think over
to fiddle with sth/to trade with sth
to rack one's brains
to tinker with/to incite
to figure out how to do something
to study meticulously/to delve into
